title: Machine Learning-Based Predictive Model Utilization Training for Managing Symptom Burden in Hemodialysis Patients (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge of hemodialysis, nursing practice experience, and basic understanding of data analysis
context.additional_context: A smartphone-based learning environment aimed at optimizing symptom management for nursing professionals.

learning_goals: Using the XGBoost model, learners can classify hemodialysis patients' symptom burden levels (mild/severe) with over 95% accuracy.
Through SHAP value interpretation, learners can analyze at least three key clinical factors influencing symptom burden.
Based on predictive model results, learners can design at least two context-specific, patient-tailored nursing intervention strategies.

resources: Simplified Machine Learning Model Interpretation Guide
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
